snippet: In Hagerstown, Ind., high school students will be making their own burgers from scratch — raising cattle to supply cheaper food for their cafeteria.
abstract: High School students in Hagerstown, Ind, are raising cattle to supply cheaper, healthier food for their cafeteria; students enrolled in agricultural science class are part of program, similar to many across country, designed to confront costs of population decline and concerns that local agricultural ties are disappearing.
lead_paragraph: In Hagerstown, Ind., high school students will be making their own burgers from scratch — raising cattle to supply cheaper food for their cafeteria.

headline.main: A Lesson in Farming, Classroom to Cafeteria
headline.print_headline: A Lesson in Farming, Classroom to Cafeteria
